text.__SUMMARY__:
Fritillaria chitralensis  is a species of flowering plant in the  lily family, native to  and Afghanistan and to the Chitral District of northern Pakistan.It is closely related to the more widely cultivated species, F. imperialis, called "Crown imperial."Fritillaria chitralensis produces bulbs up to 30 mm across. Stems can reach a height of  45 cm. Flowers are bell-shaped, hanging downwards, bright yellow.
